comment: She is an incredible prof. She really cares about her students and her classes are very democratic. She allows the class to vote on issues such as hw, tests, or anything else. Her tests are very difficult but if she gives you the option of writing a paper instead of a test take it. She is willing to go over it and give you feed back until its due.

Dr. Sharma explains concepts well and grades fairly. Follow her rubrics, do your homework, ask for help and clarification early, and you'll do well. She is always eager to help but most students don't ask until it's a few hours before the assignment is due.

Present material well, but other wise HORRIBLE nazi-like teacher. Super strict about everything. She is rude  but smiles with her teeth (fake smile) while being rude. Simply put, if I could, I would post  a list of cuss words that describes her as a teacher. AVOID.

The material is very interesting, but she makes too big deal out of her class, even though most of us are in engineering major and don't really care about psychology. She's too into research and such a harsh grader. I wouldn't recommend her.

She held review days before the tests. She made up all the questions for the review.  The questions she asked had NOTHING  to do with what was on the test. Going to class for those days was a total waste of time. I wouldn't have gone if attendance wasn't part of our grade.
Dr. Sharma is a nice lady but not a great prof. We had to do a class presentation that was graded rather harshly and then she didn't tell us why we got the grade we did.

I have to say this was one of the WORST class experiences I have ever had at  Southern Poly. Dr. Sharma was very nice but she did not prepare her students for the tests or any of the other assignments. She let us have review days before the tests which was awesome but NON of the stuff we reviewed was even close to the stuff that was on the test.
She was great!  Her examples were clear and her activities were fun.  I would recommend her to anyone!

She was a horrible professor. I would never take her again. I had her for intro to psyc and it's not worth it to take her class. she's really nice and brings her dog but her power-points weren't helpful and she didn't give good study guides or quizzes to make sure we actually understood the material before a test.

Dr. Sharma is absolutely awesome. I was in her intro to psychology class her first semester teaching here, and she was extremely helpful. She was encouraging, clear with information, and her lectures were engaging and fun. And her dog Albis is awesome!
